a.g: By those [angels] who extract with violence
And [by] those who remove with ease
And [by] those who glide [as if] swimming

w.e: And those who race each other

a.g: And those who race each other in a race
And those who arrange [each] matter,
On the Day the blast [of the Horn] will convulse [creation],
There will follow it the subsequent [one].
Hearts, that Day, will tremble,
Their eyes humbled.
They are [presently] saying, "Will we indeed be returned to [our] former state [of life]?
Even if we should be decayed bones?
They say, "That, then, would be a losing return."
Indeed, it will be but one shout,
And suddenly they will be [alert] upon the earth's surface.
Has there reached you the story of Moses? -
When his Lord called to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa,
"Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.
And say to him, 'Would you [be willing to] purify yourself
And let me guide you to your Lord so you would fear [Him]?'"
And he showed him the greatest sign,
But Pharaoh denied and disobeyed.
Then he turned his back, striving.
And he gathered [his people] and called out
And said, "I am your most exalted lord."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ولذلك قال بعض العارفين ما من نفس الا وهي مضمرة ما أظهر فرعون من قوله: ﴿ أنا ربكم الاعلى ﴾ ولكن فرعون وجد له مجالا وقبولا فأظهره اذ استخف قومه فأطاعوه وما من احد الا وهو يدعى ذلك مع عبده وخادمه وأتباعه وكل من هو تحت قهره وطاعته وان كان ممتنعا من اظهاره فان استشاطته وغيظه عند تقصيرهم في خدمته واستعباده ذلك ليس يصدر الا عن اضمار الكبر ومنازعة الربوية في رداء الكبرياء؛ فإذن العبودية شاقة على النفس مطلقا
Indeed, there is no soul [nafs] except that it conceals what Pharaoh [Fir'aun] manifested in his saying: "I am your Lord, Most High." But Pharaoh found for it an opening and acceptance, so he manifested it, for he deemed his people weak, so they obeyed him. And there is no one except that he calls to that with his servant and his attendant and his followers, and everyone who is under his coercion and his obedience—even if he refrains from manifesting it. For his rage and his fury at their shortcoming in his service and his enslavement of them—that does not issue forth except from a concealment of arrogance [kibr] and a contesting of lordship [rububiyya] in the garment of majesty [kibriya']. Therefore, servitude ['ubudiyya] is arduous for the soul [nafs] absolutely.

a.g: So Allah seized him in exemplary punishment for the last and the first [transgression].
Indeed in that is a warning for whoever would fear [Allah].
Are you a more difficult creation or is the heaven? Allah constructed it.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فلا تظنن أن ذرة من ملكوت السموات تنفك عن حكمة وحكم بل هى أحكم حلقا وأتقن صنعا وأجمع للعجائب من بدن الإنسان بل لا نسبة لجميع ما فى الارض إلى عجائب السموات ولذلك قال تعالى أأنتم أشد خلقا أم السماء بناها رفع سمكها فسواها وأغطش ليلها وأخرج ضحاها فارجع الآن إلى النطفة وتأمل حالها أولا وما صارت إليه ثانيا وتأمل أنه لو اجتمع الجن والإنس على أن يخلقوا للنطفة سمعا أو بصرا أو عقلا أو قدرة أو علما أو روحا أو يخلقوا فيها عظما أو عرقا أو عصبا أو جلد أو شعرا هل يقدرون على ذلك بل لو أرادوا أن يعرفوا كنه حقيقته وكيفية خلقه بعد أن خلق الله تعالى ذلك لعجزوا عنه فالعجب منك لو نظرت إلى صورة إنسان مصور على حائط تأنق النقاش فى تصويرها حتى قرب ذلك من صورة الإنسان وقال الناظر إليها كأنه إنسان عظم تعجبك من صنعة النقاش وحذقه وخفة يده وتمام فطنته وعظم فى قلبك محله مع أنك تعلم أن تلك الصورة إنما تمت بالصبغ والقلم واليد وبالقدرة وبالعلم وبالإرادة وشىء من ذلك ليس من فعل النقاش ولا خلقه بل هو من خلق غيره وإنما منتهى فعله الجمع بين الصبغ والحائط على ترتيب مخصوص فيكثر تعجبك منه وتستعظمه وأنت ترى النطفة القذرة كانت معدومة فخلقها خالقها فى الأصلاب والترائب ثم أخرجها منها وشكلها فأحسن تشكيلها وقدرها فإحسن تقديرها وتصويرها وقسم أجزاءها المتشابهة إلى أجزاء مختلفة فأحكم العظام فى أرجائها وحسن أشكال أعضائها وزين ظاهرها وباطنها ورتب عروقها وأعصابها وجعلها مجرى لغذائها ليكون ذلك سبب بقائها وجعلها سميعة بصيرة عالمة ناطفة وخلق لها الظهر أساسا لبدنها والبطن حاويا لآلات غذائها والرأس جامعا لحواسها ففتح العينين ورتب طبقاتها وأحسن شكلها ولونها وهيئاتها ثم حماها بالأجفان لتسترها وتحفظها وتصقلها وتدفع الأقذاء عنها ثم أظهر فى مقدار عدسة منها صورة السموات مع اتساع أكنافها وتباعد أقطارها فهو ينظر إليها ثم شق أذنيه وأودعهما ماء مرا ليحفظ سمعها ويدفع الهوام عنها وحوطها بصدقة الأذن لتجمع الصوت فترده إلى صماخها ولتحس بدبيب الهوام إليها وجعل فيها تحريفات واعوجاجات لتكثر حركة ما يدب فيها ويطول طريقه فيتنبه من النوم صاحبها إذا قصدها دابة فى حال النوم ثم رفع الأنف من وسط الوجه وأحسن شكله وفتح منخريه وأودع فيه حاسه الشم
Indeed, do not imagine that a single atom of the dominion [mulk] of the heavens is devoid of wisdom [hikma] and judgment [hukm]. Rather, it is more perfect in its links, more precise in its making, and more comprehensive of wonders than the human body. Nay, there is no comparison between all that is on the earth and the wonders of the heavens. And for that reason, the Most High said: "Are you a more difficult creation or is the heaven? He constructed it. He raised its vault and proportioned it. And He darkened its night and brought forth its morning light." Now return to the sperm-drop [nutfa] and contemplate its state first, and what it became secondly. And contemplate that if the jinn and mankind were to gather together to create for the sperm-drop hearing, or sight, or intellect, or power, or knowledge [‘ilm], or a spirit [ruh], or to create within it a bone, or a vein, or a nerve, or skin, or hair—would they be capable of that? Nay, even if they wished to know the reality [kunh] of its essence [haqiqa] and the manner of its creation after God, the Most High, had created it, they would be incapable of it. So the wonder is from you—if you were to look at the picture of a human depicted on a wall, and the painter had refined its depiction until it neared the form of a human, and the one looking at it said, "It is as if it were a human," you would marvel at the craftsmanship of the painter, his skill, the deftness of his hand, and the completeness of his acumen, and a great place would be held for him in your heart [qalb]—even though you know that this picture was only completed by paint, a pen, a hand, by power, by knowledge [‘ilm], and by will, and not a single one of those things is from the action or creation of the painter. Rather, it is from the creation of another. The utmost of his action is merely the combining of the paint and the wall in a specific arrangement. Yet you greatly marvel at him and hold him in awe. And you see the filthy sperm-drop [nutfa]—it was non-existent, then its Creator [Khaliq] created it in the loins and the ribs. Then He brought it forth from them and formed it, so He perfected its formation. And He proportioned it, so He perfected its proportioning and its shaping. And He divided its similar parts into different parts. So He perfected the bones in its corners and beautified the forms of its limbs. And He adorned its exterior and its interior, and arranged its veins and its nerves, and made them a passage for its nourishment so that would be a cause for its permanence. And He made it hearing, seeing, knowing [‘alima], speaking. And He created for it the back as a foundation for its body, and the belly as a container for the instruments of its nourishment, and the head as a gatherer of its senses. So He opened the two eyes and arranged their layers, and perfected their form, color, and states. Then He protected them with eyelids to cover them, preserve them, polish them, and repel filth from them. Then He manifested within the measure of a single lens among them the image of the heavens with the vastness of their expanses and the remoteness of their extremities—so it gazes upon them. Then He split its two ears and deposited within them a bitter water to preserve its hearing and repel creeping things from them. And He surrounded them with the concha of the ear to gather the sound and return it to its auditory canal, and to sense the creeping of insects towards it. And He placed within them curves and bends so that the movement of what creeps within them would be multiplied and its path lengthened, so that its owner would be alerted from sleep if a creature intended it during the state of sleep. Then He raised the nose from the middle of the face and perfected its form, and opened its two nostrils, and deposited within it the sense of smell.

a.g: He raised its ceiling and proportioned it.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فلا نطول بذكر عدد ذلك ومجموع عدد العظام فى بدن الإنسان مائتا عظم وثمانية وأربعون عظما سوى العظام الصغيرة التى حشى بها خلل المفاصل فانظر كيف خلق جميع ذلك من نطفة سخيفة رقيقة وليس المقصود من ذكر أعداد العظام أن يعرف عددها فإن هذا علم قريب يعرفه الأطباء والمشرحون إنما الغرض أن ينظر منها فى مدبرها وخالقها أنه كيف قدرها ودبرها وخالف بين أشكالها وأقدارها وخصصها بهذا العدد المخصوص لأنه لو زاد عليها واحدا لكان وبالا على الإنسان يحتاج إلى قلعه ولو نقص منها واحدا لكان نقصانا يحتاج إلى جبره فالطبيب ينظر فيها ليعرف وجه العلاج فى جبرها وأهل البصائر ينظرون فيها ليستدلوا بها على جلالة خالقها ومصورها فشتان بين النظرين ثم انظر كيف خلق الله تعالى آلات لتحريك العظام وهو العضلات فخلق فى بدن الإنسان خمسمائة عضلة وتسعا وعشرين عضلة والعضلةمركبة من لحم وعصب ورباط وأغشية وهى مختلفة المقادير والأشكال بحسب اختلاف مواضعها وقدر حاجاتها فأربع وعشرون عضلة منها هى لتحريك حدقة العين وأجفانها لو نقصت واحدة من جملتها اختل أمر العين وهكذا لكل عضو عضلات بعدد مخصوص وقدر مخصوص وأمر الاعصاب والعروق والأوردة والشرايين وعددها ومنابتها وانشعاباتها أعجب من هذا كله وشرحه يطول فللفكر مجال فى آحاد هذه الأجزاء ثم فى جملة البدن فكل ذلك نظر إلى عجائب أجسام البدن وعجائب المعانى والصفات التى لا تدرك بالحواس أعظم فانظر الآن إلى ظاهر الإنسان وباطنه وإلى بدنه وصفاته فترى به من العجائب والصنعة ما يقضى به العجب وكل ذلك صنع الله فى قطرة ماء قذرة فترى من هذا صنعه فى قطرة ماء فما صنعه فى ملكوت السموات وكواكبها وما حكمته فى أوضاعها وأشكالها ومقاديرها وأعدادها واجتماع بعضها وتفرق بعضها واختلاف صورها وتفاوت مشارقها ومغاربها فلا تظنن أن ذرة من ملكوت السموات تنفك عن حكمة وحكم بل هى أحكم حلقا وأتقن صنعا وأجمع للعجائب من بدن الإنسان بل لا نسبة لجميع ما فى الارض إلى عجائب السموات ولذلك قال تعالى أأنتم أشد خلقا أم السماء بناها رفع سمكها فسواها وأغطش ليلها وأخرج ضحاها فارجع الآن إلى النطفة وتأمل حالها أولا وما صارت إليه ثانيا وتأمل أنه لو اجتمع الجن والإنس على أن يخلقوا للنطفة سمعا أو بصرا أو عقلا أو قدرة أو علما أو روحا أو يخلقوا فيها عظما أو عرقا أو عصبا أو جلدا أو شعرا هل يقدرون على ذلك بل لو أرادوا أن يعرفوا كنه حقيقته وكيفية خلقته بعد أن خلق الله تعالى ذلك لعجزوا عنه فالعجب منك لو نظرت إلى صورة إنسان مصور على حائط تأنق النقاش فى تصويرها حتى قرب ذلك من صورة الإنسان وقال الناظر إليها كأنه إنسان عظم تعجبك من صنعة النقاش وحذقه وخفة يده وتمام فطنته وعظم فى قلبك محله مع أنك تعلم أن تلك الصورة إنما تمت بالصبغ والقلم واليد وبالقدرة وبالعلم وبالإرادة وشىء من ذلك ليس من فعل النقاش ولا خلقه بل هو من خلق غيره وإنما منتهى فعله الجمع بين الصبغ والحائط على ترتيب مخصوص فيكثر تعجبك منه وتستعظمه وأنت ترى النطفة القذرة كانت معدومة فخلقها خالقها فى الأصلاب والترائب ثم أخرجها منها وشكلها فأحسن تشكيلها وقدرها فإحسن تقديرها وتصويرها وقسم أجزاءها المتشابهة إلى أجزاء مختلفة فأحكم العظام فى أرجائها وحسن أشكال أعضائها وزين ظاهرها وباطنها ورتب عروقها وأعصابها وجعلها مجرى لغذائها ليكون ذلك سبب بقائها وجعلها سميعة بصيرة عالمة ناطفة وخلق لها الظهر أساسا لبدنها والبطن حاويا لآلات غذائها والرأس جامعا لحواسها ففتح العينين ورتب طبقاتها وأحسن شكلها ولونها وهيئاتها ثم حماها بالأجفان لتسترها وتحفظها وتصقلها وتدفع الأقذاء عنها ثم أظهر فى مقدار عدسة منها صورة السموات مع اتساع أكنافها وتباعد أقطارها فهو ينظر إليها ثم شق أذنيه وأودعهما ماء مرا ليحفظ سمعها ويدفع الهوام عنها وحوطها بصدقة الأذن لتجمع الصوت فترده إلى صماخها ولتحس بدبيب الهوام إليها وجعل فيها تحريفات واعوجاجات لتكثر حركة ما يدب فيها ويطول طريقه فيتنبه من النوم صاحبها إذا قصدها دابة فى حال النوم ثم رفع الأنف من وسط الوجه وأحسن شكله وفتح منخريه وأودع فيه حاسه الشم
Indeed, do not prolong the mention of the number of that. And the total number of bones in the human body is two hundred and forty-eight bones, excluding the small bones which fill the gaps of the joints. So look how He created all of that from a lowly, thin drop [nutfah]. And the intended purpose from mentioning the numbers of the bones is not that their number be known, for this is a proximate knowledge [‘ilm] which the physicians and anatomists know. Rather, the aim is that one should contemplate through them their Manager and their Creator—how He proportioned them and managed them, and varied between their forms and their sizes, and specified them with this particular number. For if He had increased upon them by one, it would have been a calamity upon the human, requiring its removal. And if He had decreased from them by one, it would have been a deficiency requiring its mending. So the physician looks into them to know the aspect of treatment in mending them, and the people of insight [ahl al-basa’ir] look into them to deduce through them the majesty of their Creator and Fashioner. So vast is the difference between the two contemplations. Then look how God, Exalted is He, created instruments to move the bones, which are the muscles. And He created in the human body five hundred and twenty-nine muscles. And the muscle is composed of flesh, nerve, ligament, and membranes. And they differ in sizes and forms according to the difference of their places and the measure of their needs. So twenty-four muscles from them are for moving the pupil of the eye and its eyelids. If one from their total were deficient, the affair of the eye would be disrupted. And thus for every limb are muscles of a specific number and a specific measure. And the affair of the nerves, the vessels, the veins, and the arteries, and their number, their sources, and their branchings, is more wondrous than all of this, and its explanation would be lengthy. So for thought [fikr] is scope in each one of these parts, then in the totality of the body. All of that is a contemplation of the wonders of the bodies of the body. And the wonders of the meanings [ma’ani] and attributes [sifat] which are not perceived by the senses are greater. So look now at the outward [zahir] of the human and his inward [batin], and at his body and his attributes, and you will see in him from the wonders and the craftsmanship what compels wonder. And all of that is the making of God in a drop of filthy water. So you see from this His making in a drop of water—so what of His making in the kingdom [mulk] of the heavens and their stars, and what of His wisdom [hikmah] in their arrangements, their forms, their measures, their numbers, the gathering of some of them and the separation of some of them, the difference of their images, and the variation of their risings and settings? So do not think that an atom from the kingdom of the heavens is devoid of wisdom and judgment. Rather, they are more perfect in structure, more precise in craftsmanship, and more comprehensive of wonders than the body of the human. Nay, there is no proportion of all that is in the earth to the wonders of the heavens. And for that reason, He, Exalted is He, said: "Are you a more difficult creation or is the heaven? He constructed it. He raised its ceiling and proportioned it. And He darkened its night and extracted its daylight." So return now to the drop [nutfah] and contemplate its state firstly, and what it became secondly. And contemplate that if the jinn and mankind were to gather together to create for the drop hearing, or sight, or intellect [‘aql], or power [qudrah], or knowledge [‘ilm], or spirit [ruh], or to create in it a bone, or a vessel, or a nerve, or skin, or hair—would they be capable of that? Nay, if they wished to know the reality [haqiqah] of its essence and the modality of its creation after God, Exalted is He, had created that, they would be incapable of it. So the wonder is from you if you looked at the image of a human depicted on a wall, and the painter excelled in depicting it until he brought that close to the image of a human, and the one looking at it said, "It is as if it is a human." Great would be your wonder at the craftsmanship of the painter, his skill, the lightness of his hand, the perfection of his acumen, and great would be his place in your heart [qalb], even though you know that that image only came to be by the dye, the pen, the hand, the power [qudrah], the knowledge [‘ilm], the will [iradah], and not a thing from that is from the action of the painter nor his creation. Rather, it is from the creation of other than him. And the utmost of his action is only the combining of the dye and the wall in a specific arrangement. So your wonder at him increases and you deem him great. And you see the filthy drop [nutfah]—it was non-existent, then its Creator created it in the loins and the ribs. Then He brought it out from them and formed it, so He perfected its formation, and proportioned it, so He perfected its proportioning and its imaging, and divided its similar parts into different parts. So He made firm the bones in their corners, and beautified the forms of its limbs, and adorned its outward [zahir] and its inward [batin], and arranged its vessels and its nerves, and made them a passage for its nourishment so that would be a cause for its permanence. And He made it hearing, seeing, knowing, speaking. And He created for it the back as a foundation for its body, and the belly as a container for the instruments of its nourishment, and the head as a gatherer of its senses. So He opened the two eyes and arranged their layers, and perfected their form, their color, and their states. Then He protected them with the eyelids to cover them, preserve them, polish them, and repel filth from them. Then He manifested in the measure of their lens the image of the heavens with the vastness of their expanses and the remoteness of their extremities—so it looks at them. Then He split its two ears and deposited in them bitter water to preserve its hearing and repel vermin from them, and surrounded them with the shell of the ear to gather the sound so it returns it to its eardrum, and to sense the creeping of vermin towards it. And He placed in them curves and bends so that the movement of what creeps in them increases and its path lengthens, so its owner is alerted from sleep if a creature intends it during the state of sleep. Then He raised the nose from the middle of the face and perfected its form, and opened its two nostrils, and deposited in it its sense of smell.

a.g: And He darkened its night and extracted its brightness.
And after that He spread the earth.
He extracted from it its water and its pasture,
And the mountains He set firmly
As provision for you and your grazing livestock.
But when there comes the greatest Overwhelming Calamity -
The Day when man will remember that for which he strove,
And Hellfire will be exposed for [all] those who see -
So as for he who transgressed
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
التحقت بالذين قال الله تعالى فيهم: ﴿ فأما من طغى وآثر الحياة الدنيا فإن الجحيم هي المأوى ﴾ فإنما أمته من اتبعه وما اتبعه إلا من أعرض عن الدنيا وأقبل على الآخرة فإنه ما دعا إلا إلى الله واليوم الآخر وما صرف إلا عن الدنيا والحظوظ العاجلة فبقدر ما أعرضت عن الدنيا وأقبلت على الآخرة فقد سلكت سبيله الذي سلكه وبقدر ما سلكت سبيله فقد أتبعته وبقدر ما اتبعته فقد صرت من أمته وبقدر ما أقبلت على الدنيا عدلت عن سبيله ورغبت عن متابعته والتحقت بالذين قال الله تعالى فيهم: ﴿ فأما من طغى وآثر الحياة الدنيا فإن الجحيم هي المأوى ﴾ فلو خرجت من مكمن الغرور وأنصفت نفسك يا رجل وكلنا ذلك الرجل لعلمت أنك من حين تصبح إلى حين تمسي لا تسعى إلا في الحظوظ العاجلة ولا تتحرك ولا تسكن إلا لعاجل الدنيا ثم تطمع أن تكون غدا من أمته وأتباعه وما أبعد ظنك وما أبرد طمعك ﴿ أفنجعل المسلمين كالمجرمين ما لكم كيف تحكمون ﴾
Indeed, you have joined those concerning whom Allah, the Exalted, said: "As for he who transgressed and preferred the life of this world [al-hayat al-dunya], then indeed, Hellfire will be the refuge [al-ma'wa]." For his community [ummah] is only those who followed him, and none followed him except he who turned away from this world [al-dunya] and turned towards the Hereafter [al-akhirah]. For he called only to Allah and the Last Day [al-yawm al-akhir], and he turned away only from this world [al-dunya] and the immediate gains [al-huzuz al-'ajilah]. Thus, to the extent you have turned away from this world [al-dunya] and turned towards the Hereafter [al-akhirah], you have traversed his path which he traversed. And to the extent you have traversed his path, you have followed him. And to the extent you have followed him, you have become of his community [ummah]. And to the extent you have turned towards this world [al-dunya], you have deviated from his path and desired to abandon following him, and you have joined those concerning whom Allah, the Exalted, said: "As for he who transgressed and preferred the life of this world [al-hayat al-dunya], then indeed, Hellfire will be the refuge [al-ma'wa]." So if you were to emerge from the abode of delusion and be just with yourself, O man—and all of us are that man—you would know that from the time you rise until the time you retire, you strive only for immediate gains [al-huzuz al-'ajilah], and you do not move nor remain still except for the immediate of this world [al-dunya]. Then you aspire that tomorrow you will be of his community [ummah] and his followers! How distant is your assumption, and how cold is your aspiration! "Then will We treat the Muslims like the criminals? What is [wrong] with you? How do you judge?"

a.g: And preferred the life of the world,
Then indeed, Hellfire will be [his] refuge.
But as for he who feared the position of his Lord and prevented the soul from [unlawful] inclination,
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقد ذكر الله تعالى في آية واحدة سبعة منها فقال: " زين للناس حب الشهوات من النساء والبنين والقناطير المقنطرة من الذهب والفضة والخيل المسومة والأنعام والحرث ذلك متاع الحياة والدنيا " ثم رده في آية أخرى إلى خمسة فقال عز وجل: " اعلموا أنما الحياة الدنيا لعب ولهو وزينة وتفاخر بينكم وتكاثر في الأموال والأولاد " ثم رده تعالى في موضع آخر إلى اثنين فقال تعالى: " وإنما الحياة الدنيا لعب ولهو " ثم رد الكل إلى واحد في موضع آخر فقال: " ونهى النفس عن الهوى فإن الجنة هي المأوى " فالهوى لفظ يجمع جميع حظوظ النفس في الدنيا، فينبغي أن يكون الزهد فيه.
Indeed, God the Exalted has mentioned seven of them in a single verse, saying: "Adorned for people is the love of desires [shahawat]—from women and children, and heaped-up heaps of gold and silver, and branded horses, and cattle and tilled land. That is the enjoyment of the life of the world [hayat al-dunya]." Then He reduced them in another verse to five, the Almighty saying: "Know that the life of the world [al-hayat al-dunya] is but play and amusement, and adornment, and mutual boasting among you, and rivalry in increase of wealth and children." Then He reduced them in another place to two, the Exalted saying: "And the life of the world [al-hayat al-dunya] is but play and amusement." Then He reduced them all to one in another place, saying: "And restrain the soul [al-nafs] from desire [al-hawa], for indeed, Paradise is the abode." So desire [al-hawa] is a term that gathers all the shares of the soul [al-nafs] in the world [al-dunya]; therefore, renunciation [zuhd] should be in it.

a.g: Then indeed, Paradise will be [his] refuge.
They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival?
In what [position] are you that you should mention it?
To your Lord is its finality.
You are only a warner for those who fear it.
It will be, on the Day they see it, as though they had not remained [in the world] except for an afternoon or a morning thereof.
